page.text: United Nations
S
Distr.: General
24 January 2005
Original: English

text.b: Official communiqué of the 5115th (closed) meeting of the
Held in private at Headquarters, New York, on Monday,

page.text: In accordance with rule 55 of the provisional rules of procedure of the Security
Council, the following communiqué was issued through the Secretary-General in
place of a verbatim record:
"On 24 January 2005, the Security Council, pursuant to annex II, sections
A and B of resolution 1353 (2001), held its 5115th meeting in private with the
troop-contributing countries to the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon
(UNIFIL) and to the United Nations Truce Supervision Organization
(UNTSO).
"The President, with the consent of the Council, extended an invitation
under rule 39 of the Council's provisional rules of procedure to Mr. Hédi
Annabi, Assistant Secretary-General for Peacekeeping Operations.
"The members of the Security Council, the troop-contributing countries
to UNIFIL and UNTSO heard a briefing by Mr. Hédi Annabi.
"The members of the Council, representatives of participating troop-
contributing countries and Mr. Annabi had a constructive exchange of views."
